medical_history.chief_complaint: Unilateral occlusion of the left internal carotid artery with ischemic optic neuropathy and cerebral infarction in a 7-day-old newborn.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with a marked pallor of the left optic nerve head during an ophthalmologic examination at 7 days of life. The newborn also exhibited focal epilepsy and mild right hemiparesis due to cortical brain damage. Anomalous elevation of plasma homocysteine occurred post-methionine load. No other thromboembolic events have occurred during the 9-month follow-up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Carrier of thrombophilic gene variants (heterozygosity for MTHFR and CBS mutations); previous episodes of focal epilepsy and mild right hemiparesis.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal MTHFR C677T heterozygosis and paternal CBS T833C/844ins68 heterozygosis.
